title: Non-Euclidean Geometry Fundamentals
content:
Vector Spaces#A vector space $V$ over a field $F$ satisfies these axioms:
$$ \begin{aligned} &\forall \mathbf{u},\mathbf{v} \in V,\ \mathbf{u} + \mathbf{v} \in V \ &\forall \alpha \in F,\ \forall \mathbf{v} \in V,\ \alpha \mathbf{v} \in V \end{aligned} $$
Eigenvalue Problem#For a square matrix $A$, find:
$$ A\mathbf{v} = \lambda\mathbf{v} $$
Where:
$\lambda$ is the eigenvalue $\mathbf{v} \neq \mathbf{0}$ is the eigenvector Matrix Exponential#The exponential of a matrix:
$$ e^{A} = \sum_{k=0}^{\infty} \frac{1}{k!}A^k $$
